cuteTool 1.0

  • Reference

    round2

    round2.Rd

    Round a vector of values, if decimal, with the desired number of decimal digits after the decimal leading zeros.

    round2(data, dec.nb = 2, after.lead.zero = TRUE)

    Arguments

    data

    A vector of numbers (numeric or character mode).

    dec.nb

    Single numeric value. Number of required decimal digits.

    after.lead.zero

    Single logical value. If FALSE, rounding is performed for all the decimal numbers, whatever the leading zeros (e.g., 0.123 -> 0.12 and 0.00128 -> 0.00). If TRUE, dec.nb are taken after the leading zeros (e.g., 0.123 -> 0.12 and 0.00128 -> 0.0013).

    Value

    The modified vector.

    Details

    REQUIRED PACKAGES

    cuteDev

    REQUIRED FUNCTIONS FROM THE cute PACKAGE

    arg_check()

    WARNINGS

    Work well with numbers as character strings, but not always with numerical numbers because of the floating point.

    Numeric values are really truncated from a part of their decimal digits, whatever options(digits) settings.

    See ?.Machine or https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5173692/how-to-return-number-of-decimal-places-in-r, with the interexting formula: abs(x - round(x)) > .Machine$double.eps^0.5.

    Examples

    ini.options <- options()$digits ; 
options(digits = 8) ; 
cat(round2(data = c(NA, 10, 100.001, 333.0001254, 12312.1235), dec.nb = 2, after.lead.zero = FALSE), "\n\n") ; 
#> NA 10 100 333 12312.12 
#> 
options(digits = ini.options)


ini.options <- options()$digits ; 
options(digits = 8) ; 
cat(round2(data = c(NA, 10, 100.001, 333.0001254, 12312.1235), dec.nb = 2, after.lead.zero = TRUE), "\n\n") ; 
#> NA 10 100.001 333.00013 12312.12 
#> 
options(digits = ini.options)


ini.options <- options()$digits ; 
options(digits = 8) ; 
cat(round2(data = c(NA, "10", "100.001", "333.0001254", "12312.1235"), dec.nb = 2, after.lead.zero = FALSE), "\n\n") ; 
#> NA 10 100.00 333.00 12312.12 
#> 
options(digits = ini.options)


ini.options <- options()$digits ; 
options(digits = 8) ; 
cat(round2(data = c(NA, "10", "100.001", "333.0001254", "12312.1235"), dec.nb = 2, after.lead.zero = TRUE), "\n\n") ; 
#> NA 10 100.001 333.00013 12312.12 
#> 
options(digits = ini.options)
